properties.areaDesc: Southern Brevard County; Martin; Northern Brevard County; St. Lucie; Indian River; Coastal Volusia
properties.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 9 at 3:49AM EST until January 9 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Melbourne FL
properties.description:
* WHAT...East winds 15 to 25 mph will produce Rough Surf and a
Moderate Risk of life threatening rip currents at the beaches of
east central Florida.

* WHERE...The beaches of Volusia, Brevard, Indian River, St.
Lucie and Martin counties.

* WHEN...Rough surf will persist through the day, while the peak
rip current threat will be late morning through mid afternoon
due to tidal effects.

* IMPACTS...Rough surf can knock you down and make you more
susceptible to being caught in the seaward pull of a Rip
Current.
properties.instruction:
Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and
float. Don't swim against the current. If able, swim in a
direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the
shore and call or wave for help.

NWSheadline: BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM EST THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING
